body.p: Along with the fully supported built-in frameworks (document types), also provides limited support (including document templates) for editing some other document types.

section.title: Markdown Documents
section.p:
includes a simple Markdown editor for documents with a file extension of .md, .markdown, .mdown, or markdn. The simple editor supports the most commonly used Markdown syntax rules. This Markdown support is available for Web Author integrations with the following types of file repositories:
Git
IBM Content NavigatorFor FileNet, a MIME type must be set to text/markdown or application/markdown.
WebDAVMarkdown documents do not support the autosave or auto-lock features for WebDAV repository integrations.
A Markdown template file is also available in the Create File dialog box when creating a new file.

section.title: Knowledge Base Articles
section.p: includes a Knowledge Base Article template available in the Create File dialog box when creating a new file. It is a DITA-based document and simply provides a starting point for a typical structure for a knowledge base article.

section.title: Image Files
section.p: You can open various types of image files in . They cannot be edited but a preview of the image is shown and you can perform normal file operations such as committing/saving to your type of repository, or copying the image to the system clipboard.
